intro: Tetranthera myrrha, commonly known as the myrrh plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and aromatic leaves. The plant produces a resinous sap that has been historically used in traditional medicine and incense. Its leaves are often used in herbal remedies for their purported anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
